DOC.brief_summary: The primary physiological impact fiber intake include gastrointestinal effect stool bulking , increase stool frequency decrease gastrointestinal transit time ( GTT ) . Fermentation resistant starch microbiota increase bacterial number , increase fecal bulk may impact frequency transit time . The purpose study determine effect resistant potato starch ( potato fiber ) stool frequency , transit time microbiota healthy individual .
DOC.detailed_description: Potato fiber ( PF-RS , PF-RO1 PF-RO2 ) , supplement diet healthy individual ( n=60 ; 20 per group ) provide 30 g per day fiber , result significant change gastrointestinal function microbiota profile . Objectives : 1 . To determine effect potato fiber stool frequency , gastrointestinal transit time gastrointestinal symptom . 2 . To determine effect potato fiber microbial diversity healthy individual .
DOC.criteria: must age 18 65. must willing complete daily questionnaire . must willing provide social security number receive study payment . Note : subject still participate unwilling provide SS # , financial reimbursement provide . must internet access duration study must usual fiber intake < 20 g/d base Food Frequency Questionnaire Block Fruit/Vegetable/Fiber Screener must willing consume koolaid everyday 2 period 14 day must willing provide stool sample must physiciandiagnosed gastrointestinal disease condition ( ulcerative colitis , Crohn 's disease , gastroparesis , cancer , peptic ulcer disease , Celiac disease , short bowel disease , ileostomy , colostomy GERD , constipation , diverticular disease ) must food allergy must take dietary supplement ( prebiotic fiber supplement )
